properties.areaDesc: Central Interior; Middle Tanana Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands; Eastern Alaska Range; Denali; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Deltana and Tanana Flats
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 29 at 6:44AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks AK
properties.description:
A weather front moving northwest over the Interior today and
tonight will bring snow and slightly warmer temperatures to the
Eastern Interior. Temperatures will rise into the teens and 20s
below across the Eastern Interior today and tonight, and could
even rise to near zero in the Eastern Alaska Range.

Snow is occuring early this morning along the Alcan Border, and is
expected to spread west to Fairbanks and Fort Yukon by noon
today, and continue spreading west to Tanana by this evening.
Snow is expected to taper off east of Fairbanks tonight, then
taper off in Fairbanks early Thursday, and taper off north and
west of Fairbanks late Thursday.

Between one and 2 inches of snow is expected in most areas,
including Fairbanks.

NWSheadline: Snow Spreading West Across the Eastern Interior Today
